c74object.name: orchidea.solution.tobuffer
c74object.digest: Import orchidea solution into a buffer
c74object.description: Receives the output of orchidea.solve and fills a given buffer with the global connection or with a specific orchidea solution.

inlet.description: The first inlet receives the solution information coming from orchidea.solve's first outlet.
Second inlet receives a list containing the segment and solution indices. If the number 0 (as a single integer) is received instead, the global connection is imported (default).

outlet.description: A bang is sent through the outlet when the import operation is completed

objarg.name: buffername
objarg.description: The argument sets the buffer name that should be filled (it can then be changed via the set message).

objarg.name: segmentnumber
objarg.description: The optional second argument sets the segment number. Use 0 to output the connection (default).

objarg.name: solutionnumber
objarg.description: The optional third argument sets the solution number.

method.name: list
method.digest: Import solution to buffer or set indices
method.description:
Left inlet should be connected to the leftmost output of a orchidea.solve object, that will send the need information about all the solutions (prefix, number of segments and number of solutions for each segment).
Right inlet expects either 0 (meaning: import the connection), or two numbers: a segment number and a solution number.
When the left inlet list is received, the corresponding solution to the specified segment is imported into the buffer given as argument, or changed via the set message.

method.name: set
method.description: A set message followed by a symbol changes the target buffer to the newly specified symbol.

entry.name: Inlet 1 (list)
entry.description: Solution information. The first inlet receives the solution information coming from orchidea.solve's first outlet.

entry.name: Inlet 2 (int/list)
entry.description: Segment and solution indices. Second inlet receives a list containing the segment and solution indices. If the number 0 (as a single integer) is received instead, the global connection is imported (default).

entry.name: Outlet 1 (bang)
entry.description: Bang when import completed. A bang is sent through the outlet when the import operation is completed
